title.@value: ABO isoimmunization of fetus or newborn

definition.@value: A condition of the newborn characterized by the destruction of red blood cells initiated by the transmission of anti-A or anti-B antibodies from a mother to the child via the placenta against A or B antigens of the newborn's blood.

label.@value: ABO isoimmunization of fetus or newborn
ABO immunisation, affecting management of pregnancy, in fetus or newborn
